page.title: 10Shopping in Patricroft
page.content: Liverpool Rd. (A57) is the main street, extending from Eccles centre to Peel Green, although there is a gap in the shops of about half a mile, towards Eccles. In the nineteenth century the area grew more rapidly than Eccles and developed small independent department stores. Nowadays, these stores have been swamped by supermarkets in Eccles and have a job to survive. There are still a lot of pubs, restaurants and snack bars, etc. mainly of the cheaper sort, catering for workmen at lunchtime rather than for people going out in the evening. There are a number of Indian and Chinese 'take-aways' which only sell food to take out. There are many vacant shops with peeling paint and dirty windows. Other shops sell greengroceries, confectionery, car spare parts and DIY goods.
